title: Upcountry train services restricted due to adverse weather
byline: The Railway Department has announced restrictions on train services along the Upcountry Railway line as heavy rainfall continues to impact several areas of the country.

title: Heavy rains over 200 mm forecast as weather system intensifies
byline: The Meteorology Department has warned that several regions of the island are expected to experience extremely heavy rainfall exceeding 200 mm as the current weather system intensifies, accompanied by strong winds.

title: A/L exams postponed due to adverse weather
byline: The Commissioner General of Examinations has issued a special announcement stating that the G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) Examination 2025 scheduled for today (27) and tomorrow (28) will not be held due to the severe disaster situation caused by adverse weather across the country.

title: 'I'm past being angry' - Liverpool in worst run for 71 years
byline: With seven consecutive wins under their belt at the start of the campaign, Liverpool seemed in prime position to put up a robust Premier League title defence and go deep in the Champions League.

title: Are 'immense' Arsenal most formidable team in Europe?
byline: Mikel Arteta says Bayern Munich are the ’’best team in Europe’’ but, after comprehensively beating them to maintain their 100% record in the Champions League, was this the night Arsenal announced themselves as serious contenders?

title: Shanaka Named Dubai Capitals Captain for ILT20 Season 4
byline: Dubai Capitals have named Sri Lankan all-rounder Dasun Shanaka as captain for ILT20 2025–26. Fresh off a title win, he brings strong T20 form and leadership experience, with coach Hemang Badani backing him ahead of their December 2 opener.

title: Colombo’s historic SSC Ground to light up for 2026 Men’s T20 World Cup
byline: The iconic Sinhalese Sports Club (SSC) Ground in Colombo is set to undergo a major transformation ahead of the 2026 ICC Men’s T20 World Cup, with the installation of floodlights and related upgrades now underway. The enhancements come as part of Sri Lanka’s preparations to co-host the tournament with India from 7 February to 8 March 2026.

title: Sri Lanka’s total debts exceed Rs. 30 trillion: Deputy Minister
byline: Sri Lanka’s total debts have risen to Rs. 30.93 trillion as of September 30 this year, Deputy Minister Anil Jayantha told Parliament today.

title: Polonnaruwa–Batticaloa Road closed: Police urge public to use trains
byline: Due to adverse weather conditions, the Manampitiya–Gallella section of the Polonnaruwa–Batticaloa main road has been flooded, resulting in a complete closure of vehicular traffic from today (27 November 2025) until further notice.

title: Train services disrupted in Matale due to landslide
byline: Train traffic in Matale has been disrupted after a landslide occurred on the railway line between Wattegama and Katugastota.

title: Traffic restored on Kelani Valley line after tree-cutting
byline: Traffic on the Kelani Valley Road has returned to normal after nearly two hours of disruption caused by tree-cutting operations.

title: Bond scam has cost more than Rs 7 billion to CB and EPF
byline: It is assumed that the famous bond scam of 2015 has cost more than 7 billion to the Central Bank (CB) and EPF though the total impact on it to the national economy is yet to be computed, Parliament was informed yesterday.

title: At least 26 dead in landslides across the country: Leader of the House
byline: At least 26 people have died in landslides across the country, Leader of the House Bimal Ratnayake told Parliament today.

title: Right section of Bentota old bridge collapses amid adverse weather
byline: The right section of the Bentota Old Bridge reportedly collapsed last night (26) due to ongoing adverse weather conditions.

title: 11 dead, multiple persons missing as landslides hit Badulla district
byline: At least 11 persons have been confirmed dead and seven others remain missing after a series of landslides, and rock and earth falls struck seven locations across the Badulla district.

title: Parliament holds emergency meeting on adverse weather
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is currently in Parliament, discussing disaster relief measures with MPs representing areas which have been hit by adverse weather conditions.

title: Adiala Jail clarifies Imran Khan remains in prison, healthy amid rumours
byline: Adiala Jail authorities on Wednesday dismissed circulating rumours suggesting that Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) founder Imran Khan had been moved out of the facility, reaffirming that he remains inside the prison and is in good health.

title: Hong Kong high-rise fire kills at least 44, leaves hundreds missing
byline: The death toll from one of Hong Kong’s worst fires in peacetime has risen to at least 44, authorities have said, with hundreds of others still unaccounted for.

title: Speaker appoints select committee to probe container clearance drama
byline: Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne today announced that he has appointed a 12-member special select committee to investigate the clearance of 323 red-labelled containers from the Colombo Port.

title: Opposition demands probe after audio clip alleges Handunneththi’s role in rice import scam
byline: While highlighting that an audio clip is being circulated on social media in which Minister Sunil Handunneththi is heard assuring someone that he will do the needful to clear a stock of rice that had been imported without a license, an opposition MP said the matter should be probed forthwith.

title: Police seize former MP Lokubandara’s pistol
byline: The Nugegoda Police Crime Division has taken custody of a pistol belonging to former MP Uditha Lokubandara, which he was seen carrying during the Joint Opposition rally in Nugegoda on November 21.

title: Nearly 1,000 prison escapes in last six years; 554 prisoners still at large
byline: Serious security lapses have been reported in Sri Lankan prisons, with 995 prisoners or suspects escaping custody over the past six years, and 554 of them still not rearrested, according to a recent audit.

title: SC affirms foreign university graduates are proud citizens of this country too
byline: The Supreme Court, in a judgment relating to a Fundamental Rights petition filed by 66 graduates holding bachelor’s degrees from various foreign universities, observed that just as much as those who graduate from State universities, foreign university graduates too are proud citizens of this country.

title: Train services disrupted on Kelani Valley line
byline: Train services on the Kelani Valley line have been disrupted after trees fell at two places between Narahenpita and Baseline Road Railway Stations.

title: Central Bank stays pat; confident inflation will hit 5%
byline: As widely expected, the Central Bank yesterday decided to keep the policy rate, the Overnight Policy Rate, unchanged at 7.75 percent at its sixth policy meeting and the final one for the year.

title: Govt. calls on private sector to expand emerging tourist destinations
byline: Leaning towards the private sector once gain to uplift the tourism industry, the government this week called on the private sector to invest in underdeveloped regions since tourism growth remains concentrated in Colombo and established hubs.

title: A/L exams commence from December 1
byline: The G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) Examination will commence on Monday, December 1, Examinations Commissioner General Indika Kumari Liyanage said.

title: Human activity on Kadugannawa slope must cease: Expert warns
byline: Former senior professor of the Department of Geology at the University of Peradeniya, Athula Senarathna, has called for an immediate halt to human activities along the Kadugannawa slope, citing serious landslide risks. The warning comes in the wake of a recent landslide in Ganethenna.

title: Heavy rain, mist cause floods and landslide risks in Nuwara Eliya
byline: Several areas in the Nuwara Eliya district have been severely affected by prevailing inclement weather, a senior official from the District Disaster Management Centre (DDMC) said.

title: Eastern line train services disrupted due to flooding
byline: Train services on the Trincomalee and Batticaloa Eastern Line have been disrupted due to severe weather conditions, the Railways Department said.

title: Upcountry train services further disrupted
byline: Train services on the Upcountry line have been further disrupted following a landslide between Great Western and Watagoda, the Railways Department said.

title: NBRO issues red alert for eight districts
byline: The National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) has issued a red alert for eight districts previously identified as vulnerable to landslides and related hazards. Authorities have urged residents in these areas to exercise extreme caution and follow safety guidelines.

title: Rugam in Batticaloa records over 300 mm of rainfall
byline: Rugam in the Batticaloa district recorded the highest rainfall in the country with 300.1 mm, as severe weather continued to batter several parts of the island, the Department of Meteorology reported today.

title: Budget debate likely to be postponed due to adverse weather conditions
byline: Party leaders are to meet at 2.00 pm today to decide on postponing the committee stage debate on the budget due to adverse weather conditions, Minister Samantha Vidyaratne said.

title: Public urged to use CEBCare app to report outages
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) today requested consumers to use its digital platforms (CEBCare app) to report power outages, as call centres are facing unusually high call volumes due to the adverse weather conditions.

title: A/L exams postponed due to severe weather
byline: The Commissioner General of Examinations has announced that the G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) Examination 2025 will not be held for the next three days, until Saturday (30), due to the severe disaster situation caused by adverse weather across the country.

title: Quake off Northern Sumatra: No tsunami threat for Sri Lanka
byline: A powerful earthquake measuring 6.6 on the Richter scale struck the Indian Ocean off Northern Sumatra, Indonesia, at 10.26 a.m. today (27), the National Tsunami Early Warning Center of the Meteorology Department said.

title: Patients continue to suffer as doctors’ strike continues
byline: Patients across the country continue to be affected as the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has decided to continue its ongoing trade union action, despite talks held with the Health Minister last morning.

title: Death toll due to severe weather climbs to 31
byline: The prevailing adverse weather conditions have claimed 31 lives since 17 November, with the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) reporting a spike in casualties over the past 48 hours.

title: Online driving licence services temporarily suspended: DMT
byline: The Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) announced that online driving licence issuance services at the Werahera Head Office and all district offices have been temporarily suspended.

title: 23 passengers rescued after bus caught in flood at Kumbukkana
byline: A bus carrying 23 passengers was caught in a flood this morning at Kumbukkana on the Monaragala-Colombo main road, but all passengers were rescued safely, the police said.

title: Report all weather-related emergencies to 117
byline: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) urged the public to report all weather-related emergencies to the 117 hotline, as severe weather continues to affect the island.

title: NBRO technical advice now mandatory for all development projects in high-risk areas
byline: A special act has been issued requiring all government institutions to obtain technical advice from the National Building and Research Organization (NBRO) when undertaking public or private development projects.

title: 75% of women face abuse on public transport in Sri Lanka: Minister
byline: Women and Child Affairs Minister Saroja Savitri Paulraj has revealed that 75% of women using public transport in Sri Lanka have experienced abuse at least once in their lives.

title: Woman remanded over alleged deliberate killing of street dog in Pannipitiya
byline: A woman arrested over the death of a street dog allegedly run over intentionally in Pannipitiya has been remanded until December 9 by the Homagama Magistrate’s Court.

title: Major flood alert issued for Mahaweli River Basin
byline: The Irrigation Department has issued a major flood warning for low-lying areas of the Mahaweli River Basin, as water levels have already risen and are expected to continue increasing.

title: Upcountry train services limited to Rambukkana
byline: Train services to the upcountry have been disrupted due to ongoing adverse weather, with landslides and fallen trees reported along the railway line between Rambukkana and Badulla.

title: Expressway travel made toll-free
byline: The Road Development Authority (RDA) has announced that vehicle movements on all expressways will be toll-free until further notice due to adverse weather conditions affecting the country.

title: Special holiday for Government offices tomorrow
byline: The government has announced tomorrow (28) as a special holiday for all government offices, citing difficulties in maintaining normal operations amid the ongoing emergency situation.

title: International schools ordered to close amid severe weather
byline: The Education Ministry has directed all international schools across country to close temporarily with immediate effect in view of the severe adverse weather affecting several parts of the country.

title: Mahinda Rajapaksa in good health: Namal
byline: Former Sri Lankan President Mahinda Rajapaksa, who was admitted to a private hospital in Colombo, is in good condition, MP Namal Rajapaksa said.

title: Death toll rises to 47 amid widespread adverse weather
byline: The Disaster Management Center (DMC) has reported that the death toll from ongoing adverse weather conditions across the country has risen to 47.

title: Preschools, early childhood centres to close from tomorrow
byline: All preschools and early childhood development centres across the country will be closed from tomorrow (28) due to the prevailing adverse weather and disaster conditions, the National Secretariat for Early Childhood Development said.

title: Tours to Kumana National Park suspended; access to Horton Plains blocked
byline: Wildlife authorities announced that tours to Kumana National Park have been suspended due to the ongoing rainy conditions affecting the area.

title: Air force helicopter rescues three trapped by floods
byline: A Bell 212 helicopter of the Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) rescued three people who were stranded on the rooftop of a two-storey building in Ella, Mahawa due to severe flooding.

title: Colombo–Badulla night mail trains cancelled; Parcel services suspended
byline: The Railway Department announced that the Colombo–Badulla and Badulla–Colombo night mail trains have been cancelled until further notice due to the prevailing adverse weather conditions affecting several railway lines.

title: Deep depression intensifies into cyclonic storm ‘Ditwah’
byline: The deep depression which had formed near the Sri Lankan coast in the Bay of Bengal has intensified into a cyclone, now named “Ditwah.”, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Mahinda Rajapaksa undergoes routine check-up at private hospital
byline: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa has been admitted to a private hospital in Colombo as part of a routine medical check-up.

title: Sri Lanka to divert flights to India during weather emergencies
byline: Minister of Ports and Civil Aviation Anura Karunathilake announced that all flights unable to land at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) during severe weather conditions will be diverted to Trivandrum or Cochin airports in India.

title: Flood warning for Maduru Oya basin extended
byline: The flood warning issued for the Maduru Oya Basin has been extended for an additional 48 hours, the Irrigation Department said.

title: Evacuation red alerts issued in seven districts over landslide threat
byline: The National Building Research Organization (NBRO has issued Red Alerts calling for the immediate evacuation of several Divisional Secretariat areas across Badulla, Kandy, Kegalle, Kurunegala, Matale, Monaragala, and Nuwara Eliya districts due to the heightened risk of landslides.

title: Donate one month’s salary for weather victims: Consumer Rights Movement urges ministers
byline: The National Movement for Consumer Rights today called on parliament ministers to contribute one month of their salary to support people affected by the ongoing extreme weather across the country.

title: Sri Lanka, Turkiye explore further ties
byline: Sri Lankan  Ambassador  to  Türkiye, Niluka Kadurugamuwa, met with the Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of Türkiye, Beris Ekenci  today  at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Ankara, marking yet another important step forward in strengthening the longstanding and friendly diplomatic relationship between the two nations.

title: Newcastle to complain about how fans were treated
byline: Newcastle United are to launch a complaint following the ’’unacceptable treatment’’ of their supporters by French police after their side’s defeat against Marseille at the Stade Velodrome.

title: 75 RDA roads severely damaged by bad weather; urgent repairs underway
byline: The Road Development Authority (RDA) announced that 75 major highways across the country have been severely damaged due to floods and landslides triggered by the prevailing adverse weather conditions.

title: Budget debate suspended for two days due to adverse weather
byline: Party leaders have decided to suspend the committee stage debate on the budget tomorrow and on Saturday because of the disaster situation, Chief Opposition Whip Gayantha Karunatilaka said.

title: President orders Rs. 1 Mn compensation for disaster victim
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has instructed the President’s Fund to provide Rs. 1 million in compensation for each person who lost their life due to the recent emergency disaster situation caused by heavy rainfall, including floods and landslides.

title: Low-pressure area forms near Sri Lanka, says India Met Dept.
byline: A developing weather system over the southwest Bay of Bengal and the Sri Lanka coast intensified into a low-pressure area on Thursday morning, according to updates from the India Meteorological Department (IMD). The system is expected to strengthen further within the next 12 hours, though officials confirm that Odisha faces no threat at this stage.

title: Kandy on alert after 180 mm rainfall, landslide risk high
byline: Kandy city has recorded 180 mm of rainfall in the past 24 hours, prompting authorities to warn of potential landslides in the upper hilly areas, the Kandy Municipal Council said.

title: Death toll from inclement weather rises to 39
byline: The number of deaths reported due to the ongoing adverse weather conditions across the country has risen to 39, according to the Disaster Management Centre (DMC).

title: Multiple National Parks  closed amid heavy rains
byline: The Department of Wildlife Conservation (DWC) has announced the temporary closure of several national parks across Sri Lanka due to ongoing heavy rains.

title: Emergency disaster situation declared in Kandy
byline: An Emergency Disaster Situation has been declared for the Kandy district due to the prevailing adverse weather conditions, the Kandy District Secretary said today.

title: Provide immediate relief to affected people: President to MPs
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has instructed Members of Parliament representing both the Government and the Opposition to urgently intervene in their respective districts to ensure the safety of the public and provide relief to those affected, as severe weather conditions and heavy rainfall are expected to intensify over the next two days.

title: Heavy rains destroy 600,000 acres of crops, vegetable prices likely to rise
byline: Heavy rains across Sri Lanka have destroyed around 600,000 acres of rice and vegetable crops, raising concerns over vegetable shortages and price hikes during the festive season, warned Anuradha Tennakoon, Chairman of the National Farmers’ Union.

title: Sri Lanka turns red
byline: The Meteorology Department has issued a high alert covering all districts and surrounding sea areas due to an active weather system affecting the island.
